name: European Special Glass Association
goal:
ESGA groups together and represents the areas of common interest in the EHS, social, economic, energy and legal fields and related industrial activities, towards the EU institutions and other relevant international organisations.
It
- monitors and studies the problems common to its members,
- organizes consultations among its members with a view to determine representative common positions on relevant issues
- represents its members at international fora
interests: Climate Action, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enterprise, Environment, Food Safety, Public Health
euInitiatives: Energy, climate change, chemicals management, Food Safety, ROHS, Seveso, air quality, soil, occupational issues, REACH, nanotechnology, state aid, industrial emissions
